hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Qais ibn Khareshah: I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. I said: O Messenger of Allah, I pledge to you that I do not fear anyone in truth. He said: So the Messenger of Allah ﷺ smiled. He said: Perhaps if your life is prolonged, you will meet rulers and you will not be able to stand with truth with them. He said: So the man remained until he met Ziyad. He said: So Ziyad refrained from him because of what reached him from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. Until he met Ubaidullah ibn Ziyad. He said: So Ubaidullah ibn Ziyad sent to him and said: Are you the one who lies against Allah Mighty and Majestic and against His Messenger upon him be peace? He said: No, but if you wish I will inform you of the one who lies against Allah Mighty and Majestic and against His Messenger upon him be peace. He said: He brought to him the torturer. He said: When he came, he said: Bring me your torture. He said: So he came torturing him. He said: So Qais died may Allah be pleased with him before the evening without anything befalling him.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ziyad ibn Sabra al-Ya'meri: I came with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ until he stood upon people from Ashja' and Juhaynah. He joked with them and laughed with them so I found something in myself. I said: O Messenger of Allah, do you jest with Ashja' and Juhaynah? So he became angry and raised his hand and struck my shoulder with it, then he said: Know that they are better than Banu Fizara, and better than Badr, and better than Banu al-Sharid and better than the people of your clan. Those ask forgiveness of Allah. When the Riddah (apostasy) occurred, not one of those whom the Messenger of Allah ﷺ favored remained except they apostatized, and I kept expecting the apostasy of my people. So I went to Umar may Allah be pleased with him and informed him, and he said: Do not fear! Have you not heard him say: Those ask forgiveness of Allah Mighty and Majestic?

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Tawil Shataab al-Mamdu: He came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said: Tell me about a man who committed all the sins and did not associate anything with Allah Most High, and he does not leave a wayfarer or a traveler except he cuts off his right hand. Is there any repentance for that? He said: Did you accept Islam? He said: As for me, I testify that there is no god except Allah alone with no partner for Him, and that you are the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. He said: Yes. Do the good deeds and abandon the evil deeds, so Allah Most High will make them for all the good deeds. He said: And my treacheries and wickedness? He said: Yes. He said: Allah is Most Great. So he kept saying Takbir (Allah is Most Great) until he disappeared. Abu al-Mughirah said: I heard al-Maysar ibn Ubayd, and he was knowledgeable in grammar and Arabic language, say: Al-hajah is the one who cuts off the wayfarers when they set out, and al-dajah is the one who cuts off them when they return.

hadiths.english_translation: Kathir ibn Ubayd al-Haddha narrated to us, Baqiyyah ibn al-Walid narrated to us, Ibrahim ibn Abi Ablah narrated to us, he said: 'I met a man from the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) who was called al-Aftas (may Allah be pleased with him), he was wearing a garment of silk (khazz).'
Al-Aswad ibn Khalaf ibn Abd Yaghuth al-Khuza'i

Ahmad ibn al-Furat narrated to us, Mu'alla ibn Asad narrated to us, Wuhayb narrated to us, from Abdullah ibn Uthman ibn Khuthaym, who said: Muhammad ibn al-Aswad ibn Khalaf ibn Abd Yaghuth narrated to me, from his father, that they found a book at the bottom of the Maqam, so Quraysh called a man from Himyar who read it to them: 'I am the Lord of Makkah al-Haram, I have blessed its people with meat and water, its sustenance comes to it from three mountains, the first to make it lawful does not make it lawful.' He said: 'O people of Quraysh, there is a phrase in it that if I told you, you would kill me.' They said: 'By al-Lat and al-Uzza, you are safe.' He said: 'Then no one will protect me from you.' We thought that it mentioned Muhammad (peace be upon him), so we concealed it. And: Ahmad ibn al-Furat narrated to us, Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, from Abdullah ibn Uthman ibn Khuthaym, from Muhammad ibn al-Aswad ibn Khalaf, from his father, who said: 'I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) accepting people's pledge of allegiance on the Day of the Conquest at Qarn Masqalah or Masfalah. I saw the young and old coming to pledge allegiance to him upon Islam and the testimony.'

hadiths.english_translation: Al-Harith ibn Waqsh (may Allah be pleased with him)

Al-Hajjaj ibn Yusuf Abu Muhammad al-Thaqafi narrated to us, Abd al-Samad ibn Abd al-Warith narrated to us, my father narrated to us, from Dawud ibn Abi Hind, Abdullah ibn Qays narrated to me, from al-Harith ibn Waqsh, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'There are no two Muslims who have four children who die before reaching puberty except that Allah the Almighty will admit them to Paradise.' They said: 'And three, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'And three.' They said: 'And two, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'And two.'

hadiths.english_translation: Abu Atiyyah (may Allah be pleased with him)

Al-Hawti narrated to us, Baqiyyah narrated to us, Bujayr narrated to us, from Khalid ibn Ma'dan, who said: Abu Atiyyah said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) came and was informed that a man had died. He said: 'The Prophet (peace be upon him) stood up along with those who were with him and prayed over him. When he was placed in the grave, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) threw dust upon him.'

hadiths.english_translation: Marhab (may Allah be pleased with him)

Abu Umayr narrated to us, Ayyub ibn Suwayd narrated to us, from Sufyan, from Isma'il ibn Abi Khalid, from al-Sha'bi, who said: Marhab informed me, he said: 'It is as if I am looking at them in the grave of the Prophet (peace be upon him) - four of them, one of them being Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf (may Allah be pleased with him).'
